original_text:
**INSTITUTION
NEUROSURGERY
DISCHARGE SUMMARY
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB]
ACCOUNT #
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Feb 29 2007]
DISCHARGE DATE :
**DATE[Mar 01 2007]
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS( ES ) :
1. SPLENIAL MASS .
2. SMALL HEMORRHAGE AT #1 .
REASON FOR ADMISSION :
This patient as brought in to **INSTITUTION after his daughter noticing some confusion while driving .
He had a CT performed which once again reveal evidence of a splenial mass .
The patient had been following with Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] for approximately two years and the lesion at baseline had been unchanged .
During that time frame while there was some questions whether it was secondary the cuts of the MRI s .
CT scan from the 29th , however , once again revealed the corpus callosum lesion with hyperdensity .
There is no definite hemorrhage .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
He was brought in .
The arteriogram revealed no evidence of internal or extracranial abnormalities .
It was essentially an unremarkable study .
There was no evidence of AVM or AV fistula .
His MRI from the 29th once again was consistent with a hemorrhage within the splenium of the corpus callosum extending to the pineal region .
As a result of these findings , the various options were discussed with the patient and Dr. **NAME[SSS] was consulted in regard to possible stereotactic biopsy for treatment .
The various options as stated earlier were discussed with the patient and it was agreed upon by the family members and the patient to be brought back for stereotactic biopsy .
The patient had a repeat MRI prior to his discharge and was deemed he will be discharged into follow-up with Dr. **NAME[SSS] in approximately four weeks .
___________________________________
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[VVV XXX , WWW-M]
**INITIALS
D : **DATE[Mar 01 2007] 07:21:13
T : **DATE[Mar 01 2007] 10:37:30
